course.subject: SCIE
course.name: Science School Induction
course.description: This is a one-year course designed for year 1 science students. It provides induction activities to help students adapt to university life, and to understand the program structure of the school and the meaning of university education. Led by faculties, staffs, and peers, students will learn and practice skills such as teamwork, communication, time management, and goal setting. Graded P or F.

reviews.author: 孤獨的美食家
reviews.title: FALL&SPRING, LAST FOR A YEAR
reviews.comment_content:
其實完全冇內容，純粹比你容易d sci school發生緊咩事
唔count任何credit，單純叫你定時定候去某d活動
eg 聽下talk，參加下workshop
全年要儲夠6項，唔夠就會fail
fail左就下年同班yr1再黎過
好似hlth1010一樣原理。
但係唔好忘記fail會冇左1st hon嘅chance
雖然冇乜幾多個local係有份

通常都係6點上到7點，冇hall/要番屋企會感覺地獄
最慘有d人天地到1030上完就係佢，但係要attendance冇得唔去

有時佢會要你去見你個mentor prof
實際上個prof冇乜用，就係揀major果時搵佢簽個名only
一年見佢3次，佢唔會記得你你亦都唔會記得佢，基本上就係冇用
reviews.comment_teaching:
阿liu係台灣人，d英文幾好聽，不過佢會突然同你講國語
上文提到，其實佢嘅作用只係在於唔知點解好委屈咁要佢hold 2堂星期五6點~7點嘅堂
仲要冇內容，只係叫佢跟住本catalog讀每個major簡介
跟住問你明唔明
同埋問你同佢個peer mentor相處成點
另一個作用就係幫你簽揀major果張form

Prof Liu其實主要係研究多過教書，基本上佢會樂意同你講佢個lab發生咩事多過同你講你major d野
果次叫佢簽major form果時就同佢吹左成粒鐘水，喺度呻佢個marine lab個RA賣甩佢去讀Poly Physio，唔幫佢做research
而且佢係一個好悠閒嘅prof，即係hea底。你會成日見到佢拎住杯咖啡喺concourse行黎行去
試過見到幾次佢拎住杯野喺atrium睇bandshow、singcon、ma-dance
聽聞佢去過名古屋大學做post-doc研究，識少少日文
好喜歡吹水，你鍾意聽佢不斷咁講野嘅話我諗佢會好開心
不過個prof只會跟你第1年，當你yr2之後佢就唔會再做你mentor，有點可惜
reviews.comment_grading:
pass or fail
冇grade可言
如果去唔齊活動fail只可以怨自己
reviews.comment_workload:
要去6次electives活動+幾堂compulsory
唔係每星期有堂/有talk
自己揀時間 還算可以控制

reviews.author: jjnie
reviews.comment_content:
one year compulsory course for SSCI year 1 students.
Activities include
- Lectures about requirements&majors
- DISC Personality Assessment
- Majors week
- Alumni sharing
- Peer mentor
- Anti-deception talk
- Personal Development Consultation etc.

You don't need to pay attention to the content throughout the entire session but some lectures have useful info about the UST curriculum and majors offered in SSCI.
reviews.comment_teaching: There is no teaching in this course. However, instructors give helpful tips about the university and they are willing to help students. If you have any question you can ask them in the Q&A section of the lecture
reviews.comment_grading: Pass/Fail.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload. Attend compulsory sessions and fulfill the course requirement to pass. Don't forget to attend compulsory sessions and pay attention to emails they send

reviews.title: Compulsory course
reviews.comment_content:
9 compulsory activities
Just make sure you mark the dates on your calendar and attend the sections required or else it would become troublesome.

reviews.author: chilboi_pillboi
reviews.title: Science School Induction
reviews.comment_content: Goes through basic stuff in University. Some things are quite useful and can help you adapt to University life as a freshman. But it's about how much you absorb the content: if you really listen, there would be some takeaways. On the other hand, if you don't listen, it's probably fine as well.
reviews.comment_teaching: The course doesn't teach you anything, but you could learn about the University and School of Science from these sessions. The speakers don't read from the slides and don't have a boring voice. Most of them also have good English, which is a bonus here at HKUST.
reviews.comment_grading:
There's no grading. It's a pass/fail course, so just make sure you join all the Zoom sessions and answer all the polls (you don't have to get those right, it's just for the sake of attendance).

In most sessions, we don't have to turn cameras on so you could just be doing whatever you want during those sessions, but don't do that.
reviews.comment_workload: There's not much workload for the course. On top of attendance, there are very few tasks that are useful and easy to handle. All of those tasks are somewhat useful too!

reviews.author: anonnick
reviews.comment_content:
Basic induction course. Mostly short lectures. Pay some attention as it does benefit your university life.

There are also time spend with senior helpers, which is quite nice.
reviews.comment_teaching: As boring as you would expected, but never went overtime.
reviews.comment_grading: Pass/Fail course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Just follow the requirements and you will pass. There are a few questionaire you will need to fill in, but it will at most take a hour to complete.
Try not to skip a require lecture as the catch-up work is a lot more annoying than an hour of mostly wasted time.

reviews.author: Tim M
reviews.comment_content: Not much content, 6 compulsory sections, and 2 selective sections, also a personal development plan and an adjustment survey. The compulsory sections are generally about science school stuff, exchange and other activities organized by science school, and also a personality test which will later be used for the personal development plan. The 2 selective sections are chosen by students from a wide variety of activities by preference.
reviews.comment_teaching: As there are not much content, the teaching is not actually important, mostly throughout the sections you will be informed of the info provided if you pay a little bit attention.
reviews.comment_grading: Pass or fail course. You need to attend to the 6 compulsory sections and 2 selective sections, iPRS will be used to take attendance, in case of failure to answer questions on iPRS,remember to go to the instructors to report and take attendance. You should be able to pass if you do all the required stuff and hand in the plan.
reviews.comment_workload: Only the personal development plan requires work.

reviews.author: Jonathan:-)
reviews.comment_content:
For BIBU students.
5 Compulsory sessions
(Need not join any session(s) in Science Major Week) +
2 Selective activities+
1 Personal development plan +
1 Adjustment Survey
[COMPULSORY] First SCIE 1000 Lesson in Fall 2017
[COMPULSORY] Anti-telephone deception and Crime Prevention offered by Hong Kong Police Force
[COMPULSORY] SCIE1000 - Meet with your Pre-major Faculty Advisor
[COMPULSORY] SCIE1000 - School Co-curricular activities (student sharing)
[COMPULSORY] SCIE1000 - Know your personality type workshop and Personal Development Plan

Meeting with your pre-major faculty advisor & student sharing part may be somewhat useful. But some others are a waste of time.
Their isn't much(or any) relation between "science" and "Anti-telephone deception and Crime Prevention " right? But since it's a attendance-taking course, you must go and listen.
reviews.comment_teaching: Adequate. You can learn some more concerning many aspects.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade PP/P/F
Make sure to go to ALL the classes in time and PRS ready.
If you fail to use your PRS, you must inform them as soon as you could.
Also remember to join a session in science major week if you are not a BIBU student.
And finish a personal development plan and complete a adjustment survey
reviews.comment_workload:
Finish a personal development plan and complete a adjustment survey is all you need to do.
Other than that, you don't have ANY work or assignment.

reviews.author: Ayush (om)
reviews.title: 1st part (half year), no problem
reviews.comment_content:
Activities to introduce about SSCI, Major Declaration, Early major declaration,....
Adviser for academic matters, really helpful, mainly for deciding courses (what to take.. and why..)
Pre-major faculty adviser: saw her only once during the compulsory session, I was decided with my major, so no need. You can go and meet the advisers anytime (office hours), they are helpful.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The last part of 1st half year was Personal Development Plan, helpful in deciding what you actually want to do.
In the next part, it will be used to help you.
Submit it on time.
The instructions (oral and written) are clear but make sure that you listened carefully to oral ones, confirm it with your friends otherwise)
reviews.comment_grading:
Just attend all compulsory sessions (sometimes choices, choose any one or two, but must attend the choosen).
If you miss any session, you fail in this course, have to repeat next year because it is a compulsory course for graduation.
1 hr (gen 50 min) long session once a week.
Grades 1/0, 1 for attending, updated on Canvas after almost 7-10 days. If you didn't receive attendance, then you must inform them before wasting anytime. (In general there isn't any such problem)
reviews.comment_workload:
Only attend, but ON Time, don't be late for more than 5 min, since attendance,.. avoid trouble, be punctual.
Also sometimes the location of the event becomes a big problem, so better verify it before time.
(A short way to verify:
1.Use Path Adviser from HKUST iLearn App or just internet direct, can give location of nearest lift, drinking fountain, toilet...
2.Download the lift map of HKUST
Using them together will ensure that you have no problem)
(One funny thing: In some sessions, if not all, you can't/shouldn't leave the room before completion, & if you leave, you must come back on time because attendance is taken again at the end of the session)

reviews.author: THello
reviews.title: FINA 2303
reviews.comment_content:
This course provides an introduction to corporate finance. Topics include financial statement analysis, time value of money, bond and stock valuation, capital budgeting, risk and return concepts and cost of capital.
You will:
- analyze financial statements and assess the financial health of companies
- value financial assets including stocks and bonds,
evaluate projects, and
- determine cost of capital of companies.
reviews.comment_teaching:
- No ppt and lecture notes.
- boring lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm mean: 62
SD(Midterm): 20 something

Final: accumulative.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very heavy workload.
- iPRS every lesson, which counts participation points.
-My Finance lab every week.
- 3 Homework assignment in total.
